body:
**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**After the rgw are not starting with ssl**

**After the upgrade rgw should work as it working before**

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
Have a cluster running with 1.2.7 rook and upgrade to 1.3.1 with ceph v15.2.0 
rgw with ssl starts to fail

**File(s) to submit**:

* Cluster CR (custom resource), typically called `cluster.yaml`, if necessary
* Operator's logs, if necessary
* Crashing pod(s) logs, if necessary
```log
20-04-15T19:44:52.944+0000 7f6d11832240  0 set uid:gid to 167:167 (ceph:ceph)
debug 2020-04-15T19:44:52.944+0000 7f6d11832240  0 ceph version 15.2.0 (dc6a0b5c3cbf6a5e1d6d4f20b5ad466d76b96247) octopus (rc), process radosgw, pid 1
debug 2020-04-15T19:44:52.944+0000 7f6d11832240  0 framework: beast
debug 2020-04-15T19:44:52.944+0000 7f6d11832240  0 framework conf key: port, val: 8085
debug 2020-04-15T19:44:52.944+0000 7f6d11832240  0 framework conf key: ssl_port, val: 8843
debug 2020-04-15T19:44:52.944+0000 7f6d11832240  0 framework conf key: ssl_certificate, val: /etc/ceph/private/rgw-cert.pem
debug 2020-04-15T19:44:52.944+0000 7f6d11832240  1 radosgw_Main not setting numa affinity
debug 2020-04-15T19:45:03.272+0000 7f6d11832240  1 robust_notify: If at first you don't succeed: (110) Connection timed out
debug 2020-04-15T19:45:03.272+0000 7f6d11832240  0 ERROR: failed to distribute cache for widas-store.rgw.log:meta.history
debug 2020-04-15T19:45:03.547+0000 7f6d11832240  0 framework: beast
debug 2020-04-15T19:45:03.547+0000 7f6d11832240  0 framework conf key: ssl_certificate, val: config://rgw/cert/$realm/$zone.crt
debug 2020-04-15T19:45:03.547+0000 7f6d11832240  0 framework conf key: ssl_private_key, val: config://rgw/cert/$realm/$zone.key
debug 2020-04-15T19:45:03.547+0000 7f6d11832240  0 starting handler: beast
debug 2020-04-15T19:45:03.549+0000 7f6d11832240 -1 ssl_private_key was not found: rgw/cert/widas-store/widas-store.key
debug 2020-04-15T19:45:03.549+0000 7f6d11832240 -1 failed to use ssl_certificate=/etc/ceph/private/rgw-cert.pem as a private key: Permission denied
debug 2020-04-15T19:45:03.549+0000 7f6d11832240 -1 no ssl_certificate configured for ssl_port
debug 2020-04-15T19:45:03.550+0000 7f6d11832240 -1 ERROR: failed initializing frontend
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'boost::wrapexcept<boost::bad_get>'
  what():  boost::bad_get: failed value get using boost::get
```


**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod):
* Storage backend version (e.g. for ceph do `ceph -v`):
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift):
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-toolbox.html)):


Cluster is in healthy state.
title: After Upgrade from 1.2.7 to 1.3.1 RGW with ssl are not working
